subject: Naming causing problems
msgSnippet: Hi All, I have searched for infor on this and found nothing (or I am looking in the wrong places). Here is a snippet from my test class:  public static
messageBody:
Hi All,

I have searched for infor on this and found nothing (or I am looking
in the wrong places).

Here is a snippet from my test class:
<snip>
public static Test suite() {
return new TestSuite(CorpusTest.class);
}


public void t(){
DelimitedListHandler d = new DelimitedListHandler
("one,two,three") ;
String expected = "one,two,three" ;

Assert.assertTrue("toString test failed", expected.equals
(d.toString())) ;

}// end test1_toString()

public void test2_toStringBuffer(){
DelimitedListHandler d = new DelimitedListHandler
("one,two,three") ;
StringBuffer expected = new StringBuffer("one,two,three") ;

Assert.assertTrue(expected.toString().equals(new
StringBuffer(d.toString()).toString())) ;

}// end test1_toStringBuffer()

public void test3_setList1(){
DelimitedListHandler d = new DelimitedListHandler
("this,is,a,random,string") ;
String s = new String("one,two,three") ;

d.setList(s) ;

Assert.assertTrue(s.equals(d.toString())) ;

}
</snip>

What is confusing me is the naming of the test method 't'. if I
change its name to 'test1_someTest' it works fine and the test runs.
If I leave it as it is the test is ignored and not run.

This is confusing as nothing I have seen states that I have to name
my tests like this (apart from a readability point of view).

Can anyone clear this up for me???

Thanks in advance

Chris
